alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:31PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Moffat, north central Uintah and Daggett Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 130 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 27 miles southeast of Squaw Hollow Boat Ramp On Flaming Gorge to 12 miles south of Manila. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Moffat, north central Uintah and Daggett Counties. This includes U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 379 and 403. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
